wins: All acceptance criteria delivered: 30+ ACs across 5 stories all implemented. FR4-8, FR11-13, FR56-62 fulfilled. No scope cuts or partial implementations
Full user journeys supported end-to-end: Create recruitment -> list/navigate -> edit details/steps -> invite team -> close recruitment workflow is complete

Ubiquitous language consistently applied: 'Recruitment' (not 'job' or 'position'), 'WorkflowStep' (not 'stage'), 'Member' (not 'participant'), 'Outcome' (not 'result') used consistently across domain, API, and frontend
Default workflow template provides fast start: 7 default steps (Screening through Negotiation) pre-populated in create form, matching domain expert expectations
Creator permanence enforced at all levels: Domain prevents removal, UI disables button, 'Creator' badge displayed — consistent UX
problems: Several empty/loading states use basic text instead of shared SkeletonLoader: Story 2.1 M4, Story 2.4 M3 — 'Loading...' text appears instead of skeleton components built in Epic 1
Closed recruitment read-only mode is partial: Edit controls are hidden but read-only display of fields like status is not consistently shown on RecruitmentPage (Story 2.3 M4)
SearchDirectory URL implies recruitment scoping but returns global directory results: This is a confusing API contract that may mislead frontend developers building against the API
No confirmation or undo for member removal: RemoveMember is immediate — no confirmation dialog like CloseRecruitment has
missing_evidence: Usability testing or user feedback on the workflow step editor (most complex UI component)
Mobile/responsive behavior — no evidence of testing below 1280px viewport
Accessibility testing for new components (axe-core, screen reader)

candidate_actions.title: Add anti-pattern for 'Loading...' text in feature components
candidate_actions.rationale: SkeletonLoader was built in Epic 1 (Story 1.4) but Epic 2 components use plain 'Loading...' text instead. This recurring pattern (2.1 M4, 2.4 M3) should be caught by a guideline.
acceptance_criteria: patterns-frontend.md documents that SkeletonLoader must be used for loading states
Anti-pattern added for 'Loading...' text in TSX files
automation_hints: Add regex to anti-patterns-pending.txt: Loading...|web/src/features/**/*.tsx|Use SkeletonLoader component instead of 'Loading...' text
candidate_actions.risk_if_ignored: Inconsistent loading states across the app, undermining the polished UX from Epic 1
